ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: this course makes you think critically about liberalism---not just what it is, but also its history and its effects.

I learned a lot of the famous liberal and anti-liberal writers of the modern age. We read some insightful articles about free speech, the failings of democracy, nationalism, King Charles II being executed, etc. It was kind of all over the place, but really a lot of fun.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: the way that the class is structured is a huge strength! the professor does an excellent job of facilitating very thoughtful and thought-provoking conversations, ones that will keep you thinking after the class is over. there is no weakness.

The course syllabus was very loose and liable to change. You had to print out whatever was assigned, and that was sort of a pain. Readings were really interesting, though. The midterm paper topic, however, was too broad.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes absolutely, by far one of my favorite classes at yale, and a huge part of that is because of professor levy-eichel, who is a fantastic teacher

I would undoubtedly recommend this course to another student. It is possibly the best course I've taken at Yale. It is certainly the course that has changed my views the most. The readings, though they were excellent, were only secondarily responsible for the intellectual development I underwent in this class. The primary cause was Dr. Levy-Eichel's questions and his guidance during office hours. He is phenomenal and any class with him is absolutely worth taking.

Take this class if you are an independent thinker. Our class sort of divided up into the liberal and conservative side of the room, sort of naturally, and perhaps thats a good thing. It was a lot of fun.
